og.Description: A “Limited Non-Assessment Period” (LNAP) is the IRS’s fancy way of describing one or more months that don’t really count for purposes of the play-or-pay penalties under the Affordable Care Act (ACA). Here are six situations that may qualify as LNAPs.
og.Title: ACA play-or-pay:  What is a limited non-assessment period (LNAP)?
